_header: A bastard shall come out of the west
Note:
An extract from 620, Thomas of Erceldoune’s Prophecy. See Murray (1875)
XMurray, J. A. H. The Romance and Prophecies of Thomas of Erceldoune
EETS 61 o.s. 61 (1875); repr. 1987.
_description: ‘When England shall be Britain’, a political prophecy — one cross-rhymed quatrain

NLWPen26.Transcription: A bastar schall come owt of the west…

NLWLan119.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 213.

NLWPen94.Transcription: a bastard shall come out of [the west]in south England borne shalbeyn [sic] shall wyn the grey for the [b]estand then this land Brytaen shalbe.
NLWPen94.Editions:
Weiskott,  Eric. 
             “An Overlooked Excerpt from  Thomas of Erceldoune.” 
             Notes & Queries
         63 (2016): 18-19: 18.
